Setting - Enum in frames
Settings for settings frames.
settings - Variable in class connections.AbstractConnection
 
settings - Variable in class frames.SettingsFrame
 
SETTINGS - frames.FrameType
 
SETTINGS_ENABLE_PUSH - frames.Setting
SETTINGS_ENABLE_PUSH (0x2): This setting can be used to disable server push (Section 8.2).
SETTINGS_HEADER_TABLE_SIZE - frames.Setting
SETTINGS_HEADER_TABLE_SIZE (0x1): Allows the sender to inform the remote endpoint of the maximum size of the header compression table used to decode header blocks, in octets.
SETTINGS_INITIAL_WINDOW_SIZE - frames.Setting
SETTINGS_INITIAL_WINDOW_SIZE (0x4): Indicates the sender's initial window size (in octets) for stream-level flow control.
SETTINGS_MAX_CONCURRENT_STREAMS - frames.Setting
SETTINGS_MAX_CONCURRENT_STREAMS (0x3): Indicates the maximum number of concurrent streams that the sender will allow.
SETTINGS_MAX_FRAME_SIZE - frames.Setting
SETTINGS_MAX_FRAME_SIZE (0x5): Indicates the size of the largest frame payload that the sender is willing to receive, in octets.
SETTINGS_MAX_HEADER_LIST_SIZE - frames.Setting
SETTINGS_MAX_HEADER_LIST_SIZE (0x6): This advisory setting informs a peer of the maximum size of header list that the sender is prepared to accept, in octets.
SETTINGS_TIMEOUT - frames.ErrorCode
SETTINGS_TIMEOUT (0x4): The endpoint sent a SETTINGS frame but did not receive a response in a timely manner.
SettingsFrame - Class in frames
The SETTINGS frame (type=0x4) conveys configuration parameters that affect how endpoints communicate, such as preferences and constraints on peer behavior.
SettingsFrame(byte, int, ByteBuffer) - Constructor for class frames.SettingsFrame
Crates a settings frame with the specified flags, streamId and payload.
SettingsFrame(int, boolean, ConnectionSettings) - Constructor for class frames.SettingsFrame
Constructs a settings frame
setValue(Setting, int) - Method in class connections.ConnectionSettings
Sets the value of a setting.
setWeight(byte) - Method in class streams.Stream
 
socket - Variable in class connections.AbstractConnection
 
startServer() - Method in class example.EchoServer
 
state - Variable in class streams.Stream
 
Stream - Class in streams
A "stream" is an independent, bidirectional sequence of frames exchanged between the client and server within an HTTP/2 connection.
Stream(int, Stream) - Constructor for class streams.Stream
Creates a stream with the specified stream id and parent.
Stream(int, Stream, byte) - Constructor for class streams.Stream
Creates a stream with the specified stream id, parent and weight.
STREAM_CLOSED - frames.ErrorCode
STREAM_CLOSED (0x5): The endpoint received a frame after a stream was half-closed.
streamDependency - Variable in class frames.HeadersFrame
 
streamDependency - Variable in class frames.PriorityFrame
 
streamId - Variable in class frames.Frame
 
streamId - Variable in class streams.Stream
 
streamMap - Variable in class connections.AbstractConnection
 
streams - package streams
 
StreamState - Enum in streams
The lifecycle of a stream is shown in Figure 2.
